newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanon's banking activity up in Q1.
newsitem.headline: Lebanon's banking activity up in Q1.

text.p: The consolidated balance sheet of Lebanon's commercial banks rose, in dollar terms, to $24,737 million at the end of March from $23,958 million at the end of 1996, the Lebanese Banks Association said on Friday.

Total deposits in foreign currencies and Lebanese pounds rose to 32,191 billion Lebanese pounds ($20,825 million) in the first quarter of the year from 30,970 billion pounds at the end of 1996, the association said in its latest monthly bulletin.
Lebanese pound deposits rose in the first quarter by 1,107 billion Lebanese pounds to 14,743 billion pounds.
Deposits in foreign currencies also rose by $119 million to $11,288 million.
Dollarisation of banks deposits registered 54.2 percent at the end of March against 55.97 percent at the end of December.
Loans and credits to the private and public sectors rose by 567 billion Lebanese pounds to 25,917 billion pounds from 25,350 billion pounds at the end of 1996.

Loans and credits to the private sector rose by 162 billion pounds to 13,452 billion pounds at the end of March from 13,290 billion while loans and credits to the public sector rose by 405 billion to 12,465 billion.
